comment: Turn up and do the work.  Really enjoyable class.
Really enjoyable class if you turn up every class.  Absolutely no problems, would def take again
DONT DO IT
Learned more than most classes

Decent guy, definitely wouldn't take again though. There are 5 reading assignments you need to show up to class though, but other than that he doesn't care about attendance. Everything was easy but the writing assignments were unfairly graded in my opinion. Can come across as rude, but he's not a bad guy.
Demanding, but cares abour student success.
Tough class, but that is what I wanted.  Dr. Sanderson really knows his stuff.

If you were coddled in high school, this class is not for you.  If you expect easy and a compliant professor this professor is not for you; however, uf you really want to be challenged and to get a great return on your tuition, this professor is for you.  Students who didn't want to do the work and students who complained spoiled the class
Pompous British-man teaching American history. The material is not clear as the professor adds bias to dated British ideologies as it pertains to the history of America. I would not recommend.

Super Caring. He is funny and makes his lectures interesting. He gave a very easy quiz at the beginning of the year just for us to have an 100% in the gradebook. Tests are online with lockdown browser and all the questions come straight from the readings or lectures. Few writing assignments that are super simple. Overall, VERY EASY.

The class was easy and Dr. Sanderson was sweet and funny. He gave extra credit opportunities in class and provided most information on the tests in his lectures. There are some multiple choice tests which are straight forward and a couple of writing assignments that are easy 100's if the prompt is followed correctly. I would 100% take him again.

Gives you a free 10% of your grade for knowing the 13 colonies, every test is online and are directly from the lectures that where he teaches you exactly what you need to know. The discussions are each worth 10% of your grade and he tells you exactly which readings to use and if you don't he will knock off points for it. His class is very easy.

Dropped this class about a month in, if that. First assignment was a paragraph for a discussion post about what we had gone over in class. I'm a good writer but there was no rubric, he gave me a 60. His feedback was VERY condescending and rude. Jokes during lectures then just complains about how bad we did. Class was too early anyway I knew to drop

Super harsh grader. I think the problem was there was no rubric so it felt like he was just handing out grades with unclear criteria. Some of the comments he made on my classmates papers were not constructive at all and gave someone a 0 starting off with "What are you doing?" While I did well in the class, I would not recommend Dr. Sanderson.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Material is easy if you paid attention to HS history. When it comes to grading discussion posts do NOT believe him when he says he's not a harsh grader. He'll give you a 0 for the smallest mistake on discussions. He spends half the class complaining about how people didn't come to class. He does NOT respond to emails. Avoid him at all costs.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: i don't think he actually reads our essays and just gives us a random grade. feedback is never constructive and he says the same thing for every single person
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Did not enjoy the class
rating_tags: Tough grader--So many papers--Graded by few things

comment: Just a no.. grades harshly and wants your “opinion” on discussions but will say it was wrong. He is nice I guess but just avoid him, it's no way prereqs should be this confusing.

Harsh, strict professor who expects “college-level responses” but offers little to no advice, and instead gives unhelpful, scalding feedback on discussions. He's extremely nit picky and tight-lipped about what sort of responses/opinions HE thinks are correct, so no matter how educated your response is, you may still end up with a 60 on a discussion
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Dr. Sanderson is a funny teacher. Love his British accent which makes his class funnier when talking about the American Revolution. He is a weird grader I must say, sometimes his grading criteria isn't very clear, and the tests aren't great, but the class is pretty easy overall. Attendance isn't mandatory but it is essential for efficient learning.

He has good intentions, I think.But really falls short in a clear grading style. The grading is unclear and extremely harsh.I am a great writer but struggled with his grading.The first two discussions I followed to the prompt to a T, but it wasn't what he thought I should write about and it dropped my grade to a 75%…

I am probably going to get a B in this class and it is not from lack of effort. He is a tough grader, pretty vague with feedback, and the majority of information comes from class. Be prepared for 5+ hours of reading and notes a week. On writing assignments he wants extreme detail,  I am a good writer and he gives me a hard time, never got an A.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Amazing lectures --Graded by few things

comment: The lecture is informative, and he uses relevant examples to help the student understand the content. The issue is the essay assignments. Certain prompts are worded weirdly and can be subjective. Feedback is 50/50: helpful or not. Attendance is not mandatory, but most answers on tests come from his words.

The way he grades is like goldilocks, go into detail but not too much detail. Whenever he has an assignment make sure to state everything never imply something. His lectors are the same as any other though he does sprinkle humor into them.

This professor isn't all too bad, yes there have been moments where his grading is questionable but I feel like as long as you email him and reason with him he'll probably do something abt the grade. His in person classes are lecture heavy but not bad at all he's very entertaining. There are 4 discussion posts and his tests are lockdown w no camera

Where do I begin…refuses to grade discussion posts by HIS OWN STANDARDS. Several students received 0s or 50s for doing it exactly as he said. These posts are opinion based and he has stated multiple times that they are giving “the wrong opinion.” It's a GEN ED class, shouldn't be this difficult smh

Even when I followed all grading criteria,still found something about my discussions to criticize. Once said I didn't include a text in my discussion when I definitely did. -10 points for turning smthn late, but syllabus said -5. Recently began teaching college if I'm right+it shows. Repeatedly touched me+my belongings w/out consent.Made me uncomfy
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria

comment: This professor is AMAZING! I have him in person and he gives great lectures, he includes the class and doesn't bore you. His test on online at home with no web came. he has one discussion post like every other week. He is great 100% recommend
Grades extremely harshly, almost randomly
